data.title: Men’s Soccer Adds 16 Newcomers to the 2024 Roster
data.meta_description: The Presbyterian College men's soccer team has added a talented 16 players signing class to the 2024 roster.
data.text:
CLINTON, S.C. - The Presbyterian College men's soccer team has added a talented 16 players signing class to the 2024 roster.

"We would like to welcome our 2024 signees to Presbyterian College and our program," said Presbyterian coach Nick Finotti. "Our staff worked diligently to identify talented players and quality people who fit PC wonderfully. We are eager to get started and expect many of them to have an immediate impact."

NATHAN ARROYO

Midfielder, Charleston, South Carolina/Stratford

A two-time All-Region selection. Played in the Clash of the Carolinas All-Star game. Earned All-Low Country honors. Played club soccer for SC United FC. Graduated high school with honors.

DESMOND BULLARD

Defender, Oakboro, North Carolina/Gray Stone Day School

Scored 116 goals with 55 assists in his high school career. Three-time All-State selection. MVP of the 2023 State Championship game after leading Gray Stone to the state championships. Played an integral role in helping his high school team capture four conference championships. Played club soccer for Charlotte Independence ECNL.

GABE CARVALHO

Defender, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada/Saint Mother Teresa HS

Named his high school team's Player of the Year twice. Played a major role in helping his club team Ottawa South United win the League One Reserves' title. Part of a club team that won the CPL Atletico Ottawa League title in 2022.

DANIEL DALEHAUG

Midfielder, Elverum, Norway/Elverum videregaende skole

Played for Elverum football club where he scored 15 goals in 79 games playing for the senior level team.

MORGAN DANCE

Midfielder, Worcester, England/Christopher Whitehead Language College

Played for Birmingham City FC in the second tier of English football. In the 2022-23 season, he scored eight goals and recorded three assists. Helped his team earn a runner-up finish in PDL 2 Cup two years in a row.

MATTHEW EVANS

Goalkeeper, Hollywood, Northern Ireland/University of Akron

Transfer from the University of Akron. Part of Northern Ireland's U16 and U18 National Team. Played for County Down at the Super Cup. Played club soccer for Crusaders FC.

HERMAN FURUMO

Midfielder, Bodø, Norway/Saltdal Videregaaende skole

Played for Fauske/Sprint a senior-level club team for five years. In the 2023 season, he was the club's top scorer. Before that, he played for Bodoe/Glimt's academy (the best senior team in Norway). While playing in the academy, he played in the prestigious Ove Helgesen Trophy, which consists of many of the best academy teams in Europe. At Fauske/Sprint, he was the club's top scorer in the 2023 season.

MIHAJLO JELIC

Defender, Phoenix, Arizona/Phoenix College

Saw action in 25 games with 17 starts in two seasons at Phoenix College. Scored two goals and tallied one assist with five shots in his two seasons at Phoenix College. Played club soccer for RSL ECNL.

LOAN MARIN

Goalkeeper, Lyon, France/Southwest Mississippi Community College

In 2023 at Southwest Mississippi, he started 15 games while recording 77 saves with four shutouts. Named MACCC Goalkeeper of the Week three times and NJCAA Division II National Goalkeeper of the Week once. Played his freshman season at Northwest College in Wyoming. Saw action in 13 games with six starts while collecting 61 saves with one shutout at Northwest College.

EDDIE MERCK

Forward, Norris, South Carolina/Daniel HS

Scored 79 goals and dished out 79 assists in his high school career. Named All-State while earning All-Region, All-Mountain Lakes, and Greenville New Upstate Player of the Year honors. Helped Daniel High School win three state championships. Played club soccer for CESA ECNL. Played a major role in helping his club team win the 2021 ECNL National Championship.

JAVIEN RAMBERT

Defender, Powdersville, South Carolina/Powdersville HS

Earned All-State honors twice. Three-time 3A All-Region selection. Helped his Carolina Elite Soccer Academy team qualify for the ECNL playoffs four times including winning the 2021 ECNL National Championship. In 2020, he attended the US Soccer Youth National Team camp. In 2021, he earned All-State and All-Region accolades in track. Earned the Patriot Scholar award.

SEBASTIAN RESTREPO

Midfielder, Simpsonville, South Carolina/Hillcrest HS

Named All-State in 2024. Two-time All-Region selection. Helped his Hillcrest High School team reach the third round of the state playoffs for the first time in 2023. In 2024, he helped his high school team earn a share of his first region championship. Earned a Scholar-Athlete Award. Played a major role in helping his CESA Triumph ECNL club team win the 2021 ECNL National Championship. In 2022, he was a Second Team ECNL Southeast All-Conference selection.

JEREMY SIAU

Defender, Granite Bay, California/Lipscomb University

A transfer from Lipscomb University, who redshirted the 2023 season. Led his Granite Bay High School to the 2022 Section finals and the Norcal semifinals. Named Granite Bay MVP in 2022. Two-time First Team All-League selection. As a senior named First Team All-Metro. Played for the Sacramento United MLS Next. Participated in the 2021 Davis Cup with Placer United ECNL.

SONNY SIMPSON

Defender, Perth, Scotland/Genesee Community College (Batavia, N.Y.)

Named Region 3 Male Athlete of the Year while helping lead the Genesee Community College to a 14-1-2 record in 2023. A First Team NJCAA All-American in 2023. Earned First Team All-Mid-State Athletic Conference and All-Region 3 honors. Garnered the NJCAA Superior Academic Award. Selected as the SUNY Chancellors Scholar-Athlete while earning Academic All-American, Academic All-Region, and Academic All-MSAC Conference honors. Helped lead Genesee to two conference championships and a national runner-up finish in 2022. In his two seasons at Genesee, he saw action in 36 games with 24 starts while scoring 15 goals and dishing out seven assists.

JOURDAN SPENCE

Forward, Brampton, Ontario, Canada/Cardinal Ambrozic

Played for Toronto FC Second Team. Helped lead Toronto FC to a first-place finish in MLS Next League. Played an integral role on a club team that won League 1 Ontario and competed in the Generation Adidas Cup. Also played club soccer for Brampton East and Toronto FC Academy.

JONAS SUNDLI-HARDIG

Midfielder, Bergen, Norway/Haugesund toppidrettgymnas

Played club soccer for FK Haugesund. Helped his club team finish in second place in the U19 national league. Played at the highest level in Norway. Team Captain for his team that competed in the third division in Norway. Played international tournaments with SK Brann. Played against youth club teams from Bayern Munich, Club Brugge and PSV.
